artist: Raffaello Vanni; Formerly attributed to Unknown Italian (Rome or Naples), 17th century
description: crowded, busy scene of horses and men fighting; empty, blank rectangle at bottom center
marks:
Inscription
on verso in graphite: [Neapol 17 Jah
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash on laid paper
provenance: [Herbert Feist, New York, until 1973; sold, June 13, as Roman, 17th century, for $325, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1973- d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Study of a Cavalry Battle for a Wall Painting
